channel.title: War Movies?
channel.description:
I'd like to know some good war movies that are out there. I only saw part of Shooter and half of Jarheads, so feel free to recommend those too if they are good ones. Anything with a lot of action or sniping would be great.
Thanks. ;)

item.title: War Movies?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I would go with:

Platoon
The Patriot
All of the rambo movies (if you need a list ask)
Braveheart
Last of the Mohicans

I’ll try to think of more later.

Read full topic

item.title: War Movies?

item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Although Band of Brothers is a series, I would highly recommend watching it!

item.title: War Movies?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:18, topic:328221”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=424608.msg3118547#msg3118547 date=1265287049]
There’s a series I just started watching that’s about WWII, it’s called Band of Brothers; in this series there are about 10 or so episodes an hour to an hour and a half each. I recommend them.
[/quote]
Old (2001 iirc), but extremely good also

Glory, glory, what a hell of a way to die![/quote]

Yup, 2001.

item.title: War Movies?
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:12, topic:328221”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=424608.msg3118412#msg3118412 date=1265255763]
I could go on forever…

Saving Private Ryan (amazing)
Shooter (excellent)
Black Hawk Down
Boys of Company C
Pearl Harbor
The Bridge on the River Kwai
The Longest Day (MUST SEE)
The Patriot
Schindler’s List
Patton
Letters from Iwo Jima
Midway
Flags of our Fathers
Tora! Tora! Tora!
Platoon
Full Metal Jacket
We Were Soldiers
Ben Hur (voted to have the most intense action scene in any movie ever)

That should keep you busy xD
[/quote]

Wow, thanks for those. :)[/quote]Out of those I highly suggest black hawk down I saw it about a month ago and it’s crazy good.

Read full topic

item.title: War Movies?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:7, topic:328221”][quote author=jme link=topic=424608.msg3118360#msg3118360 date=1265252306]
Tears of the sun, Behind Enemy Lines, etc
[/quote]

I’ve heard pretty good feedback about Behind Enemy Lines. I’ll take a look at Tears of the Sun too.

Saving Private Ryan was great and a bit brutal.

Was that a recent movie in theaters? I remember a war movie a few months back coming out but I can’t remember the name.[/quote]

In tears of the sun, it’s a small squad of navy seals transporting a large amount of people through the jungle on foot, and they must be stealthy especially when taking out the enemies. I liked it

Chassy13:

a recent movie in theaters? I remember a war movie a few months back coming out but I can’t remember the name.

Saving private ryan is not a recent movie. If you really haven’t seen it, watch it first.

Read full topic

Also, I’ve never seen it before, but my friends say that Apocolypse Now is amazing. Although, I think it’s a bit old :\
